item.title: Sidcup by-pass A20 the foot/cycle pavement is unsafe for key workers from QM Hospital in the mornings as lights out at 07:15 hrs. Reference street lights FPF017, FPF019 and FPF025., 17th January
item.description:

item.title: Human Waste: Vomit and Green Absorbent Powder Still Present, 17th January
item.description:
You arrived on Thursday to place a green substance over the vomit on Albert Road, which is assumed to be an absorbent powder. This has been left like this. The vomit is still considered to be a biohazard and requires the next stage of cleaning which is complete removal and cleansing of the pavement. The public have started walking in it and spreading it across the pavement. Correct disposal required please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
